descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course examines the musicals Fun Home, Hamilton, and Waitress in order to discuss issues of identity, inclusion, and representation on the contemporary Broadway stage. Through these three productions we will discuss the broader role of the American musical as a vehicle for exploring social issues connected to questions of racial, gender, and sexual identity. Like all Theatre 140-2 courses, this class introduces students to university-level research-paper writing that incorporates performance analysis and secondary sources. This course mixes lectures, discussion, and writing to explore methods for theatre history performance critique.
